FSC111.name: Foundational Concepts in Food Processing and Technology
FSC111.description: Principles of food chemistry, microbiology, and physical science.
FSC111.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

FSC112.name: Seminar in Food Processing, Technology and Safety
FSC112.description: Communication, organization, and time management skills for the food processing industry.
FSC112.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

FSC113.name: Basic Commodity Overview of Food Processing and Technology
FSC113.description: Principles of food processing continuum. Production, through processing, to distribution.
FSC113.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

FSC114.name: Food Processing and Technology Facilities Management
FSC114.description: Food facility design and layout. Cleaning and sanitation systems, standards, and regulations. Total quality management principles.
FSC114.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

FSC125.name: Food Processing and Technology Unit Operations
FSC125.description: Operations to prepare, process, and preserve a variety of food products and their effects of food processing on quality and shelf life.
FSC125.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

FSC211.name: Principles of Food Science
FSC211.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
FSC211.description: Scientific principles, historical perspective, and current status of technology related to food composition, safety, toxicology, processing, preservation, and distribution.

FSC222.name: Professional Development and Career Planning in Food Science
FSC222.description: Career opportunities in food science; training in oral, written, and visual communication skills for professional development.
FSC222.restrictions: Open to students in the Food Science Major.

FSC230.name: Fruit and Vegetable Processing
FSC230.description: Concepts and operations of the handling, preservation, and processing of fruit and vegetable crops
FSC230.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

FSC231.name: Cereals Processing
FSC231.description: Classification and composition of major cereal crops. Milling processes and cereal product manufacturing.
FSC231.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

FSC232.name: Dairy Foods Processing
FSC232.description: Handling and processing of milk and milk products.
FSC232.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

FSC233.name: Muscle Foods Processing
FSC233.description: Manufacturing practices and principles of fresh, frozen, and cured meats.
FSC233.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

FSC240.name: Applied Microbiology in Food Processing and Technology
FSC240.description: Microorganisms in food processing with emphasis on ecological, physiological, and public health aspects. Principles and practices to prevent food spoilage and food-borne outbreaks.
FSC240.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

FSC241.name: Safety Principles and Regulations in Food Processing and Technology
FSC241.description: Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points (HACCP), risk-based preventive controls, process validation, and statistical applications in food safety.
FSC241.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

FSC242.name: Applied Chemistry in Food Processing and Technology
FSC242.description: Chemical changes in foods as a result of formulation, processing, and storage.
FSC242.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

FSC310.name: Sensory Analysis and Consumer Research
FSC310.description: Discriminative, affective and descriptive methods used to evoke, measure, analyze, and interpret sensory reactions to food characteristics and consumer needs.
FSC310.prerequisite: (FSC 211 or HNF 150) and (STT 200 or STT 201 or STT 315 or STT 421 or STT 464)
FSC310.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Department of Food Science and Human Nutrition.

FSC325.name: Food Processing: Unit Operations
FSC325.description: Principles, technologies, and applications in conversion of raw products into high quality foods. Unit operations

FSC342.name: Food Safety and Hazard Analysis Critical Control Point Program
FSC342.description: Sources of microbiological, chemical and physical hazards; minimizing microbial growth and survival; good manufacturing, cleaning and sanitation practices; Hazard Analysis Critical Control Point Programs in food processing and food service.

FSC401.name: Food Chemistry
FSC401.description: Organic and biological reactions of food constituents. Chemical changes in foods during processing and storage affecting texture, color, flavor, stability, and nutritive qualities.
FSC401.prerequisite: BMB 200 or CEM 352 or (BMB 401 or concurrently)
FSC401.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

FSC402.name: Food Chemistry Laboratory
FSC402.description: Chemical changes in food constituents which affect stability of food products and properties such as color, flavor and texture.
FSC402.prerequisite: (FSC 401 or concurrently) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

FSC420.name: Quality Assurance
FSC420.description: Theory and application of quality assurance programs for food processing industries.
FSC420.prerequisite: (STT 200 or STT 201 or STT 231 or STT 315 or STT 351) and ((FSC 211 or concurrently) or (ANS 201 or concurrently) or (HRT 204 or concurrently))
FSC420.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students in the Department of Food Science and Human Nutrition.

FSC421.name: Food Laws and Regulations
FSC421.semester: Spring of odd years, Summer of even years
FSC421.description: Adoption, interpretation, and enforcement of laws and regulations governing food processing and foodservice systems. Impact of regulation on food production, availability, marketing, and safety.

FSC422.name: Advanced Professional Seminar in Food Science
FSC422.description: Preparation for success in food science careers, marketing tools, business communication skills, and contemporary topics in food science.
FSC422.restrictions: Open to students in the Food Science Major.

FSC429.name: Fundamentals of Food Engineering
FSC429.description: Definition and measurement of food properties, thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, heat transfer, and mass transfer.
FSC429.prerequisite: (FSC 325) and (MTH 124 or MTH 132 or LB 118 or MTH 152H) and (PHY 231 or PHY 183 or PHY 193H or LB 273)
FSC429.restrictions: Not open to students in the College of Engineering.

FSC430.name: Food Processing: Fruits and Vegetables
FSC430.description: Fruit and vegetable composition and quality indices. Harvest technology, post-harvest physiology, and preparatory systems. Principles and applications of thermal processing, freezing, and specialized techniques.
FSC430.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

FSC431.name: Food Processing: Cereals
FSC431.description: Classification and composition of cereals. Milling processes. Cereal product manufacture.
FSC431.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

FSC432.name: Food Processing: Dairy Foods
FSC432.description: Principles for production and processing of safe and wholesome dairy foods. Practical experience in safety and quality assurance systems and in the processing of fluid milk, cultured products, cheese, and frozen desserts.
FSC432.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

FSC433.name: Food Processing: Muscle Foods
FSC433.description: Manufacturing practices and principles of fresh, frozen, and cured meats and fish. Processed products from muscle foods. Product formulation and quality control.
FSC433.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

FSC440.name: Food Microbiology
FSC440.description: Major groups of microorganisms of importance to the food industry. Ecological, physiological, and public health aspects.
FSC440.prerequisite: (MMG 201 or MMG 301) and completion of Tier I writing requirement.

FSC441.name: Food Microbiology Laboratory
FSC441.description: Methods for studying major groups of microorganisms important to the food industry. Isolation, enumeration, characterization, identification, and use of microorganisms.
FSC441.prerequisite: (FSC 440 or concurrently) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

FSC442.name: Hazard Analysis Critical Control Point Training and Certification
FSC442.description: Design and implementation of Hazard Analysis Critical Control Point (HACCP) programs for the food industry. Offered second half of semester.

FSC455.name: Food and Nutrition Laboratory
FSC455.description: Principles and application of analytical techniques. Analysis for fats, proteins, carbohydrates, minerals, vitamins, and additives. Techniques include spectroscopy, fluorimetry, chromatography, electrophoresis, and proximate composition.
FSC455.prerequisite: ((BMB 200 or concurrently) or (BMB 401 or concurrently) or (BMB 461 or concurrently)) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

FSC470.name: Integrated Approaches to Food Product Development
FSC470.description: Food product development including obtaining, screening, and selecting ideas. Integration of food processing, chemistry, analysis, and microbiology for the design, production, and evaluation of a food product.
FSC470.restrictions: Open to seniors or graduate students.

FSC475.name: International Studies in Food Science
FSC475.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FSC475.description: Education abroad experience. Contemporary problems affecting food science and human nutrition in world, national and local communities.

FSC477.name: Food Engineering: Fluids
FSC477.description: Unit operations, process engineering, equipment, and industrial practices of the food industry. Manufactured dairy products

FSC481.name: Fermented Beverages
FSC481.description: Origin and history of alcoholic beverages produced by fermentation; types of products and methods of production; relationships among agricultural practices, processing and sensory attributes; responsible consumption of alcoholic beverages.
FSC481.restrictions: Open to juniors. Approval of department.

FSC482.name: Science and Technology of Wine Production
FSC482.description: Origin and history of wine and wine production. Determination and timing of harvest, methods of postharvest handling, storage, and processing of grapes into juice and wine. Physical and chemical changes in wine and processes. Analysis of must and its adjustment, fermentation, fining, and aging. Physiology of yeasts and bacteria involved in winemaking and spoilage. Cellar practices, problems, and operations.
FSC482.restrictions: Open to seniors or graduate students in the Department of Biosystems and Agricultural Engineering or in the Department of Chemical Engineering and Materials Science or in the Department of Chemistry or in the Department of Food Science and Human Nutrition or in the Department of Horticulture or in the Department of Microbiology and Molecular Genetics or in the Lyman Briggs Chemistry Coordinate Major. Approval of department.

FSC483.name: Brewing and Distilled Beverage Technology
FSC483.description: Raw materials for fermentation and basics of alcohol fermentation, beer and cider production; basics of distillation; brandy and eau de vie production; whiskey production; vodka, gin and flavored spirits production; flavor chemistry
FSC483.prerequisite: CHE 311 or (ME 410 or concurrently) or BE 350 or (BE 429 or concurrently) or (FSC 325 or concurrently)

FSC490.name: Special Problems in Food Science
FSC490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FSC490.description: Individual study of selected topics in food science. Supervised independent study.
FSC490.restrictions: Not open to sophomores. Approval of department; application required.

FSC493.name: Professional Internship in Food Science
FSC493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FSC493.description: Supervised professional experiences in agencies and businesses related to food science.
FSC493.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Food Science major. Approval of department; application required. A student may earn a maximum of 6 credits in all enrollments for any or all of these courses

FSC803.name: Advanced Food Chemistry
FSC803.description: Carbohydrates, proteins, and lipids. Purification, structural characterization, chemical reactions, and functional properties of these components in food systems.

FSC807.name: Advanced Food Toxicology
FSC807.description: Toxicology related to food safety. Metabolism of toxicants as influenced by food constituents, mutagenesis, and chemical carcinogenesis. Risk assessment.

FSC810.name: International Food Laws and Regulations
FSC810.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FSC810.description: Survey of food laws of various countries and regions.

FSC811.name: U.S. Food Laws and Regulations
FSC811.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FSC811.description: Surveys the laws and regulations governing the manufacture, distribution and sale of food products in the United States, the regulation of foods and food additives, genetic modification of food, food safety and HACCP, civil and criminal liability for defective products, inspections, labeling, importation, exportation, and current issues of concern.

FSC812.name: Food Laws and Regulations in the European Union
FSC812.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FSC812.description: Introduction to the European Union (EU), the role of case law, official controls, the European Food Safety Authority, food labeling, food additives, food fortification, genetically modified foods, organic foods, imports, food safety, inspections, enforcement and compliance, and the role of science in EU food law.

FSC813.name: Food Laws and Regulations in Latin America
FSC813.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
FSC813.description: Current issues that have shaped Latin American food regulation. Overview of regional characteristics. Basic food laws, agency responsibilities, product registration requirements, basic standards, food labeling, food safety, food additives, and food importation. Trade issues, international organizations, and commercial agreements.

FSC814.name: Food Laws and Regulations in Canada
FSC814.description: Canadian regulatory framework. Labeling and advertising rules under the Canadian Food and Drug Act and other statutes. Food additives, food supplements and food fortification. Regulation of novel foods and genetically modified foods, organic foods and food irradiation. Inspection and related food safety programs. Food recalls. Compliance and enforcement. Food importation.

FSC815.name: Food Laws and Regulations in China
FSC815.description: Current issues that have shaped the regulation of food in China, regional characteristics and culture, food laws, agency responsibilities, product registration requirements, basic standards, food labeling, food safety, food additives, and food import systems.

FSC816.name: Codex Alimentarius - The Food Code
FSC816.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FSC816.description: How Codex Alimentarius formulates and harmonizes food standards for hygiene, contaminants, food additives, veterinary drugs, and pesticide residues, including its role in the World Trade Organization (WTO) Sanitary and Phytosanitary (SPS) and Technical Barriers to Trade (TBT) Agreements.

FSC817.name: Animal Health, World Trade and Food Safety (OIE): Challenges and Opportunities
FSC817.description: Examines the history, objectives, rules and operations of the World Organization for Animal Health (OIE), regarding global animal health, animal welfare, world trade, and food safety.

FSC820.name: Regulatory Leadership in Food Law
FSC820.description: Introduction to regulatory affairs through the regulation of food.

FSC821.name: Wine, Beer, and Spirits Laws and Regulations
FSC821.description: Laws, regulations, and policies that govern alcoholic beverages in the United States.

FSC823.name: Diet and Immune Function
FSC823.description: Influence of diet on the immune system and relationship to infectious and non-infectious diseases, adverse reactions such as food allergy, and alcohol and substance abuse. Methods to evaluate immune function.

FSC842.name: Foodborne Diseases
FSC842.description: Epidemiology, isolation, characterization, clinical manifestations, pathogenicity, incidence and control of bacterial, parasitic and viral foodborne pathogens and associated toxins.

FSC843.name: Exposure Science and Environmental Epidemiology
FSC843.description: Human exposure to chemicals in food and the environment and its relationship to health and illness. Applied concepts in toxicology, exposure assessment, environmental epidemiology, and risk assessment.

FSC844.name: Risk Assessment of Foodborne Chemicals and Toxins
FSC844.description: Human health risk assessment, including hazard identification, dose-response and exposure assessment, and risk characterization. Application to food safety and environmental risks.

FSC851.name: The Law of the Foreign Supplier Verification Program Rule
FSC851.description: Legal perspective of FDA's Foreign Supplier Verification Program of the Food Safety Modernization Act.

FSC852.name: The Law of the Preventive Controls for Human Food Rule
FSC852.description: Legal perspective of FDA’s Preventive Controls for Human Food Rule of the Food Safety Modernization Act.

FSC853.name: The Law of the Produce Safety Rule
FSC853.description: Legal perspective of FDA’s Produce Safety Rule of the Food Safety Modernization Act.

FSC890.name: Special Problems in Food Science
FSC890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FSC890.description: Individual investigation of an area of food science.
FSC890.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in Food Science. Approval of department; application required.

FSC891.name: Selected Topics in Food Science
FSC891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FSC891.description: Topics of current interest and importance in basic and applied areas of food science.
FSC891.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Food Science major or Human Nutrition major.

FSC892.name: Food Science Seminar
FSC892.description: Critical review of literature. Organization and communication of scientific data in food science.
FSC892.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Food Science and Human Nutrition.

FSC898.name: Master's Research
FSC898.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FSC898.description: Directed research in support of Plan B master's degree requirements.
FSC898.restrictions: Open only to master's students in Food Science. Approval of department.

FSC899.name: Master's Thesis Research
FSC899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FSC899.restrictions: Open only to master's students in the Food Science major.

FSC999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
FSC999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FSC999.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Food Science major.
